djf.components

Class AppWorkspaceComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • djf.components.AppWorkspaceComponent

  • public abstract class AppWorkspaceComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class provides the structure for workspace components in our applications. Note that by doing so we make it possible for customly provided descendent classes to have their methods called from this framework.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected javafx.scene.layout.Pane workspace 
      protected boolean workspaceActivated 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AppWorkspaceComponent() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateWorkspace(javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane appPane)
      When called this function puts the workspace into the window, revealing the controls for editing work.
      javafx.scene.layout.Pane getWorkspace()
      Accessor method for getting the workspace.
      abstract void reloadWorkspace(AppDataComponent dataComponent)
      This function must be defined in the actual workspace component class and should be called after data has been loaded and the workspace must use it to initialize controls.
      abstract void resetWorkspace()
      This function must be defined in the actual workspace component class and should be called before loading new data.
      void setWorkspace(javafx.scene.layout.Pane initWorkspace)
      Mutator method for setting the custom workspace.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • workspace

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppWorkspaceComponent

        public AppWorkspaceComponent()

    • Method Detail

      • activateWorkspace

        public void activateWorkspace(javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane appPane)
        When called this function puts the workspace into the window, revealing the controls for editing work.
        Parameters:
        appPane - The pane that contains all the controls in the entire application, including the file toolbar controls, which this framework manages, as well as the customly provided workspace, which would be different for each app.

      • setWorkspace

        public void setWorkspace(javafx.scene.layout.Pane initWorkspace)
        Mutator method for setting the custom workspace.
        Parameters:
        initWorkspace - The workspace to set as the user interface's workspace.

      • getWorkspace

        public javafx.scene.layout.Pane getWorkspace()
        Accessor method for getting the workspace.
        Returns:
        The workspace pane for this app.

      • resetWorkspace

        public abstract void resetWorkspace()
        This function must be defined in the actual workspace component class and should be called before loading new data.

      • reloadWorkspace

        public abstract void reloadWorkspace(AppDataComponent dataComponent)
        This function must be defined in the actual workspace component class and should be called after data has been loaded and the workspace must use it to initialize controls.
